resend.title: Resend email doesn't work in production environment with Next.js, but works in development
resend.description: Works perfectly in localhost but fails in Vercel production. Environment variables (RESEND_API_KEY) not being read correctly in production deployment.

resend.title: Resend API works perfect in localhost but not on my Netlify website
resend.description: Getting 500 error when deployed to Netlify. API KEY obtained from import.meta.env.API_RESEND works locally but fails in production.

resend.title: Gmail marks transactional emails as 'suspicious or spam' despite proper DNS configuration
resend.description: Transactional emails sent through Resend/React Email are being flagged by Gmail. DNS configuration and verification are properly set up but images are hidden and emails marked suspicious.

resend.title: Email not being sent with NextJS server actions with Resend.com
resend.description: NextJS 13.5.1 with server actions enabled. Form submission should send email but fails silently. No clear error messages in production.

resend.title: Email dev directory links broken in React Email
resend.description: Development environment links in React Email templates are broken. Affects local development workflow when building email templates.

liveblocks.title: Can't modify storage LiveObject while using liveblocks - set method not working
liveblocks.description: Developer unable to modify LiveObject storage using the set() method inside useMutation hook. Getting 'TypeError: thisCentralCard.set is not a function' error despite following the official Liveblocks storage tutorial. The get() method works correctly but set() fails, suggesting a potential issue with LiveObject initialization or mutation patterns.

knock.title: Knock notification service not working when triggered by cron job in NextJS
knock.description: Developer using Knock as notification system in React/NextJS app. Notifications work when manually triggered from frontend button, but fail silently when triggered from a cron job. The knock.workflows.trigger() call completes without errors but Knock does not receive the notifications. Issue appears to be related to async execution context in cron jobs vs direct API calls.

knock.title: Knock notifications work in development but fail in production with enhanced security mode
knock.description: Developers report that Knock notifications work perfectly in development environment but fail silently in production. The issue is often related to enhanced security mode requiring signed user tokens in production environments. Without proper user token generation and signing, API calls succeed but notifications are not delivered.

metadata.source: Real unresolved developer issues from Stack Overflow and community forums
metadata.searchMethod: Manual verification of real unresolved Stack Overflow questions and community forums
updates: Focused on real, unresolved Stack Overflow questions from developers
Liveblocks: 1 high-quality issue with code examples and error details
Resend: 5 production deployment and email delivery issues
Knock: 2 issues - cron job triggering and production security mode
All links verified to be working and contain real developer problems
Prioritized issues with rich technical details and reproducible code
metadata.note: All issues are real, unresolved developer problems from Stack Overflow and community forums. Knock issues focus on workflow triggering and production deployment challenges.
